website_summaries.verdict: Although it isn't without its sour patches, SugarSync (for Android) is a pretty sweet deal for Android users seeking 5 free gigabytes of full-featured cloud-based backup for photos and more.
pros: More storage and features than DropBox
Enables users to specify a folder(s) to back up
cons: Must enable Photo AutoSync in Settings (same goes for 3G syncing)
Photo glitches required quitting app and clearing cache
Changes not always fast to take affect

customer_reviews.title: Excellent on laptop and tablet but not smartphone
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant must have app that works flawlessly on computers and tablets. The only problem i have found is on my Samsung phone where the app runs the battery flat in less than a day. Not much point using the app on there if i cant use my phone !
customer_reviews.author: iain

customer_reviews.title: Excellent app
customer_reviews.text: allows you to see some files on your desktop/laptop computer and other machines. It's no dropbox (yet) but it fills a role particularly in enteprise when you have to have access to files on the go.
customer_reviews.author: L8again

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a day, set up all my folders, perfect. But now it just errors 'sugarsync has stopped'. I use sugarsync on my macs, works well, but just not on the Kindle. Roll on the next version.
customer_reviews.author: David Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Sugarsync helps me to get my tablet in sync with my computer and is very easy to use. I have used others but find this the easiest
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Can't migrate items from Cloud to Device
customer_reviews.text: It is an okay program that at least did half of what I needed it to do. The frustration is that once you sync to the cloud, you can only access the items from the cloud which means you must be connected. The whole point of syncing (for me) was to move some files from desktop to device/Kindle so I could access 24/7 -- I wanted them on my Kindle! So not only do you deal with the limitations of your Kindle (that is, being only able to work with certain type files), but also dealing with the limitations of the app.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: even better now
customer_reviews.text: loved old sugar sync. I did like seeing each of my synced computers and the different folders in the old Sugarsync and I was a little confused with the new SS; but it is so intuitive and works so well. An absolute genius developed this. Absolutely love it. It is great to have all of your giles at your fingertips without having to go to different computers. And everything js accessible on Kindle Fire.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Did eventually work..a little, which was more than the other cloud filesystems could handle.
customer_reviews.text: Managed to populate a small document file through ES File Manager's cloud interface onto Kindle Fire TV's directories, but a multimegabyte binary file is taking much longer to appear on Amazon's device. Also experienced a problem with the upload status leaving an incorrect, bitRotted_frozen progress notification banner active in the pulldown menu drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Ebay's Better

customer_reviews.title: Great app!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old tablet running an ancient version of the Android OS so my device isn't supported on Google Play. I use SugarSync on my desktop and my mobile phone. So when I saw this app in the Amazon app store, I had to give it try. IT WORKS FLAWLESSLY!!! ~sorry for shouting~~ I'm a technology professional so when stuff works the way it's supposed to I get a bit excited.
customer_reviews.author: WJC6140

customer_reviews.title: Great program but...
customer_reviews.text: Sugarsync is my favorite syncing and cloud service except for two things. It seems to have no kindle app that lets me access content on my kindle fire, and it also doesn't have the app integration of Dropbox. Change those two things and I'd choose it 100 percent of the time. We want cloud storage to provide a single, simple solution. Sugarsync comes close!
customer_reviews.author: Ariana Morris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing app (and cute icon!!!)
customer_reviews.text: I love this app. It can be a wee bit confusing at times but I haven't read everything I should have about it. Just one complaint -- well, two:you can't "select all" when moving or syncing images or videos AND I swear. I was once able to share data/text -- but now I just get a useless .apk file on my desktop :( -- if anybody knows how to open these things please let me know!!! ~@rhea.raptou1@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: M DeLong

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable; all you need for your files in the cloud
customer_reviews.text: It all boils down to reliability. It has synced the files I want in all my 5 computers; it keeps previous versions of files saved; it lets you manage and access your files from anywhere via an internet connection or by syncing all your computers (all you need is to install a light application). I highly recommend SugarSync.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea, all about sales!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but it is all about sales. So at least the free version, is designed to tease you with promise, but every click is going to tell you that you need to upgrade or that your friends need to sign up to view photos. Not easy to navigate either, I am sure that if I used it more the features would become familiar.
customer_reviews.author: Sandler L. Burkley

customer_reviews.title: Works but confusing
customer_reviews.text: Better be a "self-taught" type person. I never found real clear instructions on how to use SugarSync. I wanted it to sync Word files between my Kindle, laptop & iPhone. What I did get figured out worked fine. Someone has to come up with an easier app that works with different platforms.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I used this when it was free
customer_reviews.text: I used this when it was free. I stopped using it when they started charging for their service. There are free alternatives. They do what they claim to do, though. Their computer interface and the smartphone apps are fairly easy to understand and use.
customer_reviews.author: tonymcc

customer_reviews.title: It works fine for me
customer_reviews.text: When at your desktop drag photos or folders into the SugarSync app and then when you have opened your Kindle you will find your items. For photos a little menu pops up at the bottom saying "Open In" and then you select Photos and there you can see them in large size.
customer_reviews.author: Gisella Patharkar

customer_reviews.title: Its your only option
customer_reviews.text: Since the Kindle does not have Dropbox or Google Drive my only pick for mobile file sync is SugarSync. I feel i have to do more than what i would with a Dropbox or a Google Drive in order for me to have things on my kindle and computer. I am not saying that this is a terrible app for mobile sync but if Dropbox was available i will imeditly switch over. The app works for when it is needed to
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Nice but app needs some improvement
customer_reviews.text: I really like SugarSync. It is easy to set up for PC and Kindle Fire. My problem is that the app always runs on the Kindle Fire no matter what settings I use. Since it runs the battery down and interferes when I'm using WiFi for some of the other apps I have, I have uninstalled it. I would prefer if the app did not run at all until I open it.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen D

customer_reviews.title: No sdcard external storage support
customer_reviews.text: I found the software quite pleasant to use. The 5GB are a great offer. Not having support to external storage was a huge disapointment as I like to take pictures with my standalone camera. The only way to transfer and share my pictures would be to having access to the sdcard. Since external storage is not supported this software fails to adress my need.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Great app!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great way to be able to share data among all of my devices including my iPhone, kindle, computer and android tablet. So far it 's been easy, intuitive, and useful for easily and quickly sharing files on the go no matter which device I happen to be using.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C

customer_reviews.title: OVEREXAGERATED
customer_reviews.text: It's abilities and ease of use is very exaggerated and overvalued. I bought the app thinking there was no charge with NOTHING indicating (at lease if it did, it was not obvious) it was a "trial" version. Then one day I was informed my app had expired. I waited a couple days then went to their website again and the same message popped up and informed me they would wipe my information from the files on a certain date. I paid for the next year but DO NOT PLAN TO DO IT AGAIN. I did not have time right then to search for a new program but now I have a year to do research and find a better program.
customer_reviews.author: Kermit Robertson

customer_reviews.title: just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: I could not get drop box or drive to sync on my new kindle fire so I was pleased when I found this app. Not that much storage for free but it should be okay for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: A. Siler

customer_reviews.title: Syncs your files
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to sync files from my computer to my Kindle & phone. I can open documents that I need from my computer anywhere I am, pretty cool. And it syncs instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It didn't sync well with other things and kept crashing my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kit234

customer_reviews.title: Cloud Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Well, I tried it but I like Dropbox better so I removed it from my Kindle HDX 8.9 shortly after the trials.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: SugarSync is great
customer_reviews.text: I use SugarSYnc so much as an in-between for pushing movies to my iPad that even though I did not want it to go to a paying service that I paid for the initial 'cheap year'. However, after the first year I will be looking for an alternative method.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Scott

customer_reviews.title: It was an ok app when it was free
customer_reviews.text: This app did what I needed it to do, but now that the service is vastly overpriced, I've switched to Dropbox.
customer_reviews.author: ClM

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. I've used for years - now added to more devices.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Altman

customer_reviews.title: so hard to use...
customer_reviews.text: Not the least bit user friendly...Pain in the rear to understand...I hate it! Unless you are pretty tech savy don't waste your time!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: FREE easy way to access documents from any device with out using Google.
customer_reviews.text: Love that I can access documents from anywhere and I didn't have to put them on Google! I can edit on any platform and the changes get synched.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cloud service
customer_reviews.text: I use this instead of Google. This service is private so finding your information isn't as accessible from cyber thieves as other services.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Useless. Does nothing as advertised. It is a waste of your time and simply gives you one way to waste another hour.
customer_reviews.author: David Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind if my laptop dies.
customer_reviews.text: SugarSync is working great for this Grandma.I have a backup of my thousands of photos and if my laptop dies, then at least I won't lose what is most important to me.I love that I can access photos on all of my devices without having to transfer to each individually. Now I can just pick up my Kindle or iphone and tap into SugarSync and everything is at hand.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowlight

customer_reviews.title: Easy and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I am sure there are less expensive services out there but I have found this product to be well worth the cost. It is well organized and customer service is responsive
customer_reviews.author: J. Fallon

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works for syncing but is difficult to configure. Most apps now come with their own sync anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Robert55

customer_reviews.title: This is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: It synced everything between my PC, iPad, iPhone, and Kindle Fire. It's a great app to have for all of my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Brave

customer_reviews.title: Great way to share files!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using another file sharing program for years, but was disappointed that when a file was shared, it took up space in both user's accounts. What I like about Sugarsync is that you can see the files, and view them, but don't necessarily need to download them all. It only counts against your storage when you download the file into your folder.
customer_reviews.author: Rammfest

customer_reviews.title: This app does not work
customer_reviews.text: This app does not work. I have not been happy with this product at all. I wished to sync my calendars and I have not be able to get that done.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Fred Voss

customer_reviews.title: Great app. Very disappointed that it does not work ...
customer_reviews.text: Great app. Very disappointed that it does not work with the Kindle Fire HDX. So I will either have to return the HDX or switch to another cloud service.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia S. Tognetti

customer_reviews.title: a must-have app!!!
customer_reviews.text: this app is amazing! i can keep all my data available to all my devices and very easily accessible! i would recomend this app to anyone and everyone!!!
customer_reviews.author: sbtolley

customer_reviews.title: sync
customer_reviews.text: SugarSync copies everythlng fast zn easy to cloud and you don't lose anything thank you for your service.keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: bruce turner

customer_reviews.title: Early Days but OK so far.
customer_reviews.text: We only received this 2 days ago and they already want a review. OK, here goes. It seems to help but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. Lathan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to access from multiple channels
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Sugar Sync to back up media on my laptop, home PC and my Droid and have the ability to sync that media across machines. It was very easy to set up and choose the specific folders I wanted to back up on each machine. Now SS runs in the background and automatically backs up media changes in the folders I selected, syncs those to other machines as I've configured it to and I can access all backed up media anytime, from any web browser. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon-er

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool for sharing with ipad, android phone and kindle
customer_reviews.text: Some problems in finding what you want, but very helpful in syncing programs and files. With a little practice you get to make the best use of what it has to offer.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Roger LeDuc

customer_reviews.title: This is a grest app!
customer_reviews.text: This "sync" to the cloud does everything I need. And with the app on my Kindlee Fire I can pull down files I need from anywhere I find wireless.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: This works
customer_reviews.text: SugarSync does exactly what it says it does. Like a hummingbird you can drill down to those files on your work computer that you really need, and sync them to all of your mobile devices. Thanks SugarSync for giving me access to what is important no matter where I am. Colleagues think I'm organised!
customer_reviews.author: TBozcan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use across multiple devices.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use interface. I was experiencing some delays in uploading files, but this can easily be remedied by editing the settings for the upload speed. Our office team uses it among several devices: Blackberry, Iphone, Windows PC's, Kindle Fire HD. You receive more "free space" than DropBox. We upgraded for extra space due to the backing up pictures which takes quite a bit of GB.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rideout

customer_reviews.title: Now that I have my new Blackberry Passport, I ...
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have my new Blackberry Passport, I can now give SugarSync 5 starts for usability I have been waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Miracle
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a dropbox type program that I can access anywhere from any computer. I just got Sugar Sync because it works with my Amazon Kindle. I am pleasantly surprised that it is so awesome. Since Apple restricts their services from being shared with my Kindle this is the perfect link between my MacBook and other devices!
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: not for me
customer_reviews.text: some of us are not high tech people. This product is probably a good product for some people, but is not very usable for me
customer_reviews.author: James Larry Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Forget it if you want to sync music!!
customer_reviews.text: The description of this app says you can sync your music, but after trying for over 2 hours the only thing that would sync from my PC to my Kindle Fire was the album art from my music!! Uninstalling...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best cloud storage service!
customer_reviews.text: As a cloud disaster service, sugarsync it's the best one. 5giga byte of storage plus wonderful windows client. And the android client is the must complete I've ever tried.
customer_reviews.author: S.A.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I really liked Sugarsync when it first came out and it was my first Cloud Storage provider. It did allow you to select certain folders for backup and even have a Magic Briefcase for syncing selected data across all devices. Ultimately it's pricing structure was too high and I moved to OneDrive.
customer_reviews.author: awraynor

customer_reviews.title: Can't control what it up loads so be careful.
customer_reviews.text: I deleted every occurrence of SugarSync from my machines since I was unable to figure out how to limit what information was uploaded to the Cloud and keep it from being public. I want to keep what I have under control and not let everything be made public, I quickly went over my storage limit.
customer_reviews.author: SWiser

customer_reviews.title: Very useful app
customer_reviews.text: I have this app install on all of my devices, and it is fantastic for syncing information across all of them. It's especially useful for Kindle Fire owners who do not have the data cable that connect to the PC.
customer_reviews.author: Damiano S. Tocco

customer_reviews.title: Generally like it
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to do. My only issue is that it's a real load on the CPU when running, particularly on my older computers. Still worth it though.
customer_reviews.author: RJM

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Software
customer_reviews.text: This is a FANTASTIC piece of software. A must if you want your documents, pictures, etc. portable. Automatically backs up pics from phone. Gives you 2.5x the space of dropbox and has more functionality. Just as easy to use as dropbox. Makes shifting smart phones easier too.
customer_reviews.author: Kashyap

customer_reviews.title: Best transfer app ever
customer_reviews.text: ,does what it advertises,easily and effortlessly,no problems whatsoever,I just love how it uploads and transfers files across all devices easily.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Batson

customer_reviews.title: Great App
customer_reviews.text: Best sync software available. If you use dropbox or box.net UNINSTALL AND GET THIS INSTEAD! I swicthed from dropbox and I will never go back
customer_reviews.author: Jiulong

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: I've tried almost all similar programs, but Sugar box is by far the best. More storage, great user interface, easy to use on my Viewsonic gtablet.
customer_reviews.author: Bob KCMO USATop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Dropbox no even close
customer_reviews.text: Messed with it for awhile and uninstalled. Glad it was free. I would recommend Dropbox over this app. Much easier to set-up & use.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Berman

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: SLOW as molasses in winter. Don't bother with this distressingly inefficient and ridiculously insufficient piece of excrement. Just plug in your Kindle and transfer files. (I had to meet a word minimum - thus the extra adjectives!)
customer_reviews.author: Bob DeDea

customer_reviews.title: Good App
customer_reviews.text: Works well! It syncs up your desktop, kindle, iphone and all that in lickety-split time. Share your photos of scabs and old tacos.
customer_reviews.author: Bigg Tee

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product on my computer, IPhone and Kindle Fire. It is very easy to use, it backs up important documents and is a necessity for file sharing over long distances. If you work from remote locations or travel frequently, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wes F

customer_reviews.title: Works well across all platforms
customer_reviews.text: Since there was no dropbox on the Amazon store I decided to try SugarSync. I must say I am impressed with how well its worked on every platform that I own. its also very User friendly.
customer_reviews.author: BaZz

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My wife can use her tablet to look up pics without having to download from the computer. This is an easy way for my wife to view photos on her Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: pigpen

customer_reviews.title: Very very good
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Easy to use interface. App runs completely independent of a PC. It's actually more functional then dropbox.
customer_reviews.author: DSY

customer_reviews.title: Useful but not yet great
customer_reviews.text: It is probably a 3.5. The UI is still somewhat mysterious although support is, so far, reasonably responsive and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SugarSync
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work well for me. one two three four five six seven eight nine ten eleven twelve thirteen to fulfill required number of words.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Tice

customer_reviews.title: Haven't figured this out yet
customer_reviews.text: This may be beyond me. I don't see a good tutorial. Perhaps if I look on-line. Is it in the Kindle Tips and Tricks book?
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: If you need more than this go back to desktop
customer_reviews.text: Sets up easily, you are in control. If there is a problem, stop and look at what you are doing. Awesome app!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: mike
customer_reviews.text: it works great and i enjoy using it. as a substitute to dropbox i like the automatic backup and the extra storage.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Not much use yet
customer_reviews.text: Not much use yet- I probably will use it more later this year to coordinate documents between several of my devices
customer_reviews.author: Edward Brown

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: Great little application I use it on my laptop, Kindle and smartphone. Also great for syncing files with other people.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: The best two-way mobile sync
customer_reviews.text: SugarSync on Android is the ultimate mobile productivity tool - sync folders to the device, edit on the go (even without connectivity) and sync back to the cloud and your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Yecies

customer_reviews.title: Everything I want it to do!
customer_reviews.text: App did everything I ever wanted to do plus it's easy enough to work. No more dropbox or Box! It provides the files where you need them and backs them to the cloud at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: mark twain

customer_reviews.title: Great for Sharing and backing up
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for about a month now and it is a great program for transferring data back and forth between my kindle fire and laptop. I would highly recommend it but warn that at first it can be a little confusing to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, but not for me ...
customer_reviews.text: ... because I am NOT tech savvy. I downloaded SugarSync after reading a much trusted review site. It IS a helpful tech-tool. I don't have the experience to use it to it's full potential - which is laziness on my part. Like most Granny's, I need my 9-yr-old neighbor to help me figure this out! hahahaha
customer_reviews.author: Jeri McGinnis

customer_reviews.title: perfect app!
customer_reviews.text: wonderful that it works across all my devices! andriod, iphone, and windows perfect between all of them! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Hilty

customer_reviews.title: Magic Briefcase is great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a MacBook, PC, Droid4 and now my Kindle Fire all hooked up and being used. The "Magic Briefcase" makes it very easy to use everywhere, all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Ronbettger

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: I find this product very useful and the price is right. I am now able to free up to 5gb on my computer. Every little bit helps. I recommend this highly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sharkey

customer_reviews.title: Haven't really used it much
customer_reviews.text: Has 5 gigs of cloud storage. I don't usually post stuff so can't really say anything for or agin it.
customer_reviews.author: Art Rose

customer_reviews.title: SugarSync Works for What I Need
customer_reviews.text: After having many issues with Dropbox, I found SugarSync. I don't really use the program very often but when I do, it's on my Kindle Fire and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: missjillybeanz

customer_reviews.title: Terribly confusing
customer_reviews.text: This app has not worked and explanations are not simple. I keep getting emails saying I haven't downloaded it and I have.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Schneweis

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: this new version in may works great. auto uploat pics works and better queue for uploading in background. excellent program!
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: Using this for Sideloading Kindle Fire
customer_reviews.text: This works well with App Backup for moving Play store apps to my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 from android phone. Learning more about what it can do.
customer_reviews.author: David Freitag

customer_reviews.title: Cloud storage
customer_reviews.text: I found this while viewing a Youtube video. I guess the typical 5 gig of storage and chance to increase with signing up other people.
customer_reviews.author: dfong

customer_reviews.title: They are charging for storage now - DO NOT GET
customer_reviews.text: This used to be a good service, but now they are charging for even the smallest amount of use. AVOID.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Smith

customer_reviews.title: learning
customer_reviews.text: I am learning to use so I can not rate this product with any certainty. Too bad I need so many words to tellyou
customer_reviews.author: dutch uncle

customer_reviews.title: Requires another account
customer_reviews.text: I downloaded this because I wanted to access my dropbox and I thought SugarSync would be able to do this. Unfortunately, you need to create a SugarSync account to use this and I don't want to make another account with another service.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelAmazonUsr
